intro: Polygonum zuccarinii, commonly known as the Zuccarinii knotweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive nodes and often bright-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in clusters and are often surrounded by bracts. Polygonum zuccarinii is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
